questions.question: What is the main objective of the experiment you're about to perform?

answers.a: To measure the viscosity of sugar solutions using a viscometer
answers.b: To determine the acceleration due to gravity using viscosity measurements
answers.c: To compare the refractive indices of various liquids
answers.d: To calculate the volume of different sugar solutions

questions.question: Briefly explain how the viscosity coefficient is defined and measured using an Ostwald viscometer?

answers.a: It is the force required to lift a unit volume of liquid in a capillary tube.
answers.b: It is the ratio of shear stress to shear strain in a liquid.
answers.c: It is the tangential force per unit area needed to maintain a unit velocity gradient between layers of a liquid.
answers.d: It is the resistance of a liquid to flow due to its density.

questions.question: How does the comparison method work in this experiment to determine the concentration of an unknown sugar solution?

answers.a: By comparing the taste of different sugar solutions
answers.b: By comparing the colors of various sugar solutions
answers.c: By comparing the flow times and densities of sugar solutions with a reference solution
answers.d: By comparing the pH levels of different sugar solutions

questions.question: Why should the temperature be kept constant throughout the experiment?

answers.b: Because temperature change affects the calibration of the viscometer
answers.c: Because temperature change affects the humidity of the air, which affects the experiment
answers.d: Because the temperature variation might break the viscometer

questions.question: What is the relation between the viscosity and density of a liquid??

answers.a: Viscosity and density vary inversely to each other
answers.b: Viscosity and density are independent of each other
answers.c: Viscosity and density vary proportionally to each other
answers.d: Viscosity and density vary exponentially to each other
